acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.12mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 890mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.203 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 465mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 336mg/kg, 794mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 99-6 (2000)), 760mg/kg and 656mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.203 (2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF<13(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 32%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3451 Toluidine (solid)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#3451 Toluidine (solid))

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: No data are available on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and somatic cell mutagenicity in vivo, while somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (DNA damage tests) show positive results, which are supported by mutagenicity tests in vitro (positive for chromosome aberration; negative for reverse mutation) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.203 (2004), DFGOT Vol.3 (1992) and CERI Hazard Data 99-6 (2000)). However, these positive data are considered to be of a low reliability, and hence cannot serve as a basis for classification into Category 2.

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 482degC (ICSC, 2004)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 44-45degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on a 1-hour inhalation study in rats (CERI Hazard Data 99-6 (2000)): "The substance produced irritation of the eye and upper respiratory tract." Also based on the evidence of "severe irritation" from a 24-hour eye irritation study in rabbits (CERI Hazard Data 99-6 (2000)). The substance is thus considered severely irritating to the eye.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 99-6 (2000)): "The substance induced moderate to severe irritation of the skin" (though the results are not those of 4-hour application).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed based on the Buehler Method (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.203 (2004)): "erythema was observed; sensitization, positive." The substance is thus considered a sensitizing skin irritant.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "20 subjects (6-19%) were diagnosed with methemoglobinemia" (DFGOT vol.3 (1992).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system, blood system, kidney, urinary bladder)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, blood system, kidney, urinary bladder)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "methemoglobinemia and hematuria" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), "methemoglobinemia and hematuria, headache, fatigue, dizziness or nausea" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.202 (2004)), "methemoglobin formation, headache, fatigue, dyspnea, neuropathy, irritation of the kidney and bladder inducing hematuria" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2001)).
